Event.name: Separating
Event.definition:
<def-root>These words refer to separating a <fen>Whole</fen> into <fen>Parts</fen>, or separating one part from another. The separation is made by an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> and may be made on the basis of some <fen>Criterion</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">I</fex> <t>divided</t> <fex name="Whole">the class</fex> <fex name="Parts">into groups</fex> <fex name="Criterion">in alphabetical order</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Whole
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>. It is usually the NP Object of a target verb. <ex>The directors <t>split</t> <fex name="Whole">the company</fex> in two.</ex> <ex> The teacher <t>divided</t> <fex name="Whole">the children</fex> into groups. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Parts
Arg.definition: <def-root>This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole: <ex>The directors <t>split</t> the company <fex name="Parts">in two</fex>.</ex> <ex>The teacher <t>divided</t> the children <fex name="Parts">into groups</fex>.</ex> <ex>The teacher <t>separated</t> the children <fex name="Parts">from each other</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Part_1
Arg.definition: <def-root>Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb. <ex>First, <t>separate</t> <fex name="Part_1">the yolks</fex> from the whites. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Part_2
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First, <ex><t>separate</t> the yolks <fex name="Part_2">from the whites</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something. The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument: <ex><fex name="Agent">The researcher</fex> <t>divided</t> subjects into groups. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Criterion
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element expresses a property of the Parts or components of the Whole which is used as the basis for separation. Criterion is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of</ment>.... <ex>The researcher <t>divided</t> subjects into groups <fex name="Criterion">on the basis of eye color</fex>.</ex> As with the frame General.Joining (above), words in this frame can be used statively, as in <ment>The rooms are separated by a partition</ment>, inchoatively, as in <ment>The group separated</ment> or causatively, as in <ment>I separated the laundry</ment>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the <fen>Agent</fen> who separates or the undergoers of the separation. <ex><fex name="Depictive">Naked</fex>, <fex name="Agent">Selma Bouvier</fex> <t>separated</t> <fex name="Part_1">the yolks</fex> <fex name="Part_2">from the whites</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act of the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the separation. <ex>You can <t>bisect</t> an angle <fex name="Mns">by drawing three circles</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of an event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.</def-root>

Arg.name: Recipients
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Recipients</fen> are the groups who come into possession of the <fen>Parts</fen> of the <fen>Whole</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agent">Mrs. Simpson</fex> <t>divided</t> <fex name="Whole">the candy</fex> <fex name="Recipients">between her children</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs. <ex>I <t>divided</t> the prize money among the winners <fex name="Time">that night</fex>.</ex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>Where the separation occurs. <ex>You should <t>separate</t> the yolks from the whites <fex name="Place">over the sink</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Instrument</fen> used to cause the separation. <ex>I <t>sectioned</t> the block <fex name="Inst">with a knife</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: divide.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: separate into parts or groups

lexUnit.name: part.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move apart or divide to leave a central space.

lexUnit.name: segregate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: set apart from the rest or from each other.

lexUnit.name: separate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: divide into constituent or distinct elements.

lexUnit.name: split.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: divide or cause to divide into parts or groups.

lexUnit.name: partition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or state of dividing or being divided into parts.

lexUnit.name: sever.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: separate one part from another by cutting.
